thread.title: Wheat Kings respond to loss with blowout wins
thread.title_full: Wheat Kings respond to loss with blowout wins

title: Wheat Kings respond to loss with blowout wins
text:
By: 
After the Wheat Kings 
Jayce Hawryluk had a first period hat trick en route to a four-goal and one-assist effort against the Pats, the second five-point night of his career. He duplicated the effort on Tuesday against the Giants, scoring a goal and adding four helpers. After going pointless in his first two games, Nolan Patrick posted eight points in the next three games. John Quenneville has eight points in the three games he’ 
Before play on Wednesday, Brandon (3-1-0-1) sat a point behind the Prince Albert Raiders (4-1-0-0) in second place in the East Division. The Moose Jaw Warriors (2-0-1-0) had played just three games before Wednesday’s tilt with the Giants and had five points, while the Saskatoon Blades (1-0-3-0) also had five points in four games despite winning just one game. The Swift Current Broncos (1-2-1-0) have three points in four games and sit in fifth while the Regina Pats (1-3-0-0) have two points in four games. Moose Jaw and Saskatoon are the only teams in the league that haven’ 
Brandon’ 
After a woeful 0-for-20 start to the season with the extra man, the Wheat Kings broke through on Saturday with four power-play goals against the Pats and two more against the Giants on Tuesday. With six goals in 32 chances, they now sit at 18.8 per cent efficiency, which is 13th in the league before last night’ 
The Wheat Kings usually field a top regular season power play. Here’s a five-year look at their numbers: 2014-15 (25.7 per cent, second in the WHL), 2013-14 (25.9 per cent, second) 
"The puck’s just going in the net. It’s nice. Everything I’m touching is either going in the net or someone else is putting it in the net. These don’t come often so I’ll take them. — 
»
